official-title.#text:
Approving the location of a memorial to commemorate the more than 5,000 slaves and free Black
			 persons who fought for independence in the American Revolution.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following joint resolution; which was referred to the

action-desc.#text: Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

quote.#tail: , numbered 869/86501 B and dated June 24, 2003, is approved.
quote.#text: Commemorative Areas Washington, DC and Environs

text.#text:
That the location of a commemorative work to honor the more than 5,000 slaves and free Black
			 persons who fought in the American Revolution, authorized by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, within Area I
			 as described on the map entitled

action-desc.#text: Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, provides that the location of a
			 commemorative work in Area I, as depicted on the map entitled

quote.#text: Commemorative Areas Washington, DC and Environs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
authorized the National Mall
			 Liberty Fund D.C. to establish a memorial on Federal land in Area I or
			 Area II, as depicted on such map, to honor the more than 5,000 slaves and
			 free Black persons who fought for American independence in the
			 Revolutionary War; and

of the Administrator’s
			 determination that such memorial should be located in Area I: Now,
			 therefore, be it
